properties.displayName: In Notion, make sure to add your connection to the pages you want to access.
properties.name: notionNotice
blockId

Not a valid Notion Block ID

properties.description: The Notion Block to append blocks to

properties.name: blockId

properties.errorMessage: Not a valid Notion Block URL
Not a valid Notion Block ID

values.name: type
values.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

text
values.description: Text content. This field contains the actual content of your text and is probably the field you'll use most often.

values.description: The URL that this link points to

values.name: mentionType
values.description: An inline mention of a user, page, database, or date. In the app these are created by typing @ followed by the name of a user, page, database, or a date.

values.name: user
values.description: The ID of the user being mentioned. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

values.name: page
values.description: The ID of the page being mentioned

values.name: database

Not a valid Notion Database ID

values.description: The Notion Database being mentioned

values.description: An ISO 8601 format date, with optional time

values.name: dateStart
values.description: An ISO 8601 format date, with optional time

values.name: dateEnd
values.description: An ISO 8601 formatted date, with optional time. Represents the end of a date range.

values.name: phoneValue
values.description: Phone number. No structure is enforced.

values.name: multiSelectValue
values.description: Name of the options you want to set. Multiples can be defined separated by comma. Choose from the list, or specify IDs using an expression.

values.name: selectValue
values.description: Name of the option you want to set. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

values.name: statusValue
values.description: Name of the option you want to set. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

values.name: emailValue
values.description: Email address

values.name: urlValue
values.description: Web address

values.name: peopleValue
values.description: List of users. Multiples can be defined separated by comma. Choose from the list, or specify IDs using an expression.

values.name: relationValue
values.description: List of databases that belong to another database. Multiples can be defined separated by comma.

values.name: checkboxValue
values.description: Whether or not the checkbox is checked. true represents checked. false represents unchecked.

values.name: numberValue
values.description: Number value

values.name: range
values.description: Whether or not you want to define a date range

values.name: includeTime
values.description: Whether or not to include the time in the date

values.name: date
values.description: An ISO 8601 format date, with optional time

values.name: dateStart
values.description: An ISO 8601 format date, with optional time

values.name: dateEnd
values.description: An ISO 8601 formatted date, with optional time. Represents the end of a date range.

values.name: timezone
values.description: Time zone to use. By default n8n timezone is used. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

values.name: url
values.description: Link to externally hosted file

values.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

values.description: The URL that this link points to

values.name: mentionType
values.description: An inline mention of a user, page, database, or date. In the app these are created by typing @ followed by the name of a user, page, database, or a date.

values.name: user
values.description: The ID of the user being mentioned. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

values.name: page
values.description: The ID of the page being mentioned

Not a valid Notion Database ID

values.description: The Notion Database being mentioned

values.description: Whether or not you want to define a date range

values.name: date
values.description: An ISO 8601 format date, with optional time

values.name: dateStart
values.description: An ISO 8601 format date, with optional time

values.name: dateEnd
values.description: An ISO 8601 formatted date, with optional time. Represents the end of a date range.

options.name: strikethrough
options.description: Whether the text is struck through

values.name: phoneValue
values.description: Phone number. No structure is enforced.

values.name: multiSelectValue
values.description: Choose from the list, or specify IDs using an expression

values.name: selectValue
values.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

values.name: statusValue
values.description: Name of the option you want to set. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

values.name: urlValue
values.description: Web address

values.name: peopleValue
values.description: List of users. Multiples can be defined separated by comma. Choose from the list, or specify IDs using an expression.

values.name: relationValue
values.description: List of databases that belong to another database. Multiples can be defined separated by comma.

values.name: checkboxValue
values.description: Whether or not the checkbox is checked. true represents checked. false represents unchecked.

values.name: numberValue
values.description: Number value

values.name: range
values.description: Whether or not you want to define a date range

values.name: includeTime
values.description: Whether or not to include the time in the date

values.name: date
values.description: An ISO 8601 format date, with optional time

values.name: dateStart
values.description: An ISO 8601 format date, with optional time

values.name: dateEnd
values.description: An ISO 8601 formatted date, with optional time. Represents the end of a date range.

values.name: timezone
values.description: Time zone to use. By default n8n timezone is used. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

values.name: url
values.description: Link to externally hosted file

options.name: iconType
Emoji
options.description: Use an Emoji for the icon

options.name: File
options.description: Use a file for the icon

options.name: icon
options.description: Emoji or File URL to use as the icon
